name: Take a photo pointing directly up
description:
As soon as you receive this question, take a photo pointing directly up.
You must hold your camera directly above your head and point your camera up. 
You may not obscure the photo.
You may not move before taking the photo.

name: Take a photo containing three buildings
description:
Take a photo showing at least some part of 3 different buildings.
Each building must have a different facade and entrance.
Your photo must be at least 50% building.

name: Take a photo containing one tree
description:
Take a photo showing the entirety of one real tree. No part of the tree may touch the corners of the frame or be behind something.
The tree must be at least 1 metre tall.

name: Take a photo of the dep
description:
Go to the nearest depanneur.
Take a photo of the main entry. Your photo must show the entire entry.

name: Take a picture of the chairs in a metro
description:
Go to the nearest metro station.
Take a photo of one player sitting on one of the chairs on the platform.
Your photo must show the entire body of the person sitting.

name: Take a picture of a body of water
description:
Take a photo of a body of water at least 1 metre across.
Your photo must show at least 1 metre of the surface of the water.

name: Take a picture of a cup of coffee
description: Get a coffee from a coffee shop. Take a picture of the cup of coffee from all sides and from above. You may not cover any part of the cup.

name: Send a sign haiku
description: Send a haiku (5-7-5) made of signs. The signs must be the main sign of a business.

name: Closest street
description: Send the seekers the name of the street closest to you at the time you answer the question.

name: Send the first letter of your nearest metro station
description: Send the first letter of your nearest metro station.

name: What is the price of the nearest hotel?
description: Send the price of the nearest hotel that shows up on google maps, to the nearest $10.

name: How good is the local timmies?
description: Send the star rating on Google Maps of your closest Tim Hortons

name: River or Mountain?
description: Are you closer to Mt Royal Park, or the St Laurent River?

name: East or West
description:
Are you east or west of the seeker’s location?
East or west is defined using Montreal North as north.

name: North or South
description:
Are you north or south of our location?
North or south is defined using Montreal North as north.

name: Radar
description: If the distance between you and the seekers is less than the distance they specify, say yes. Otherwise, say no.

name: Post code match
description: Check the post code of the seekers and yourself. Count how many characters are the same in both postcodes. For example, H2J 3P6 and H2J 3A2 share 4 characters.

name: Describe something badly
description:
Find the closest article to you on Wikimap.wiki.
Send the seekers one sentence from the body of the article.
A sentence must be more than 5 words and end with a full stop. You may re-order the words of the sentence any way you like.

name: Send the length of your nearest park
description: Send the length of the longest straight side of your nearest park.

name: Take a screenshot of your location
description:
Zoom to the maximum level possible on google maps.
Take a screenshot which contains your location marker. You may not crop or edit the screenshot.

name: Wifi
description: Look at available wifi networks on your phone. Tell the seekers the network with the most signal.

name: Get up and clap
description: Stand up and clap as loud as you can ten times.

name: Denomination of nearest church
description: Send the christian denomination of your nearest church, e.g. Catholic, Orthodox, Baptist etc.

name: Pic of a tall building
description: Send a picture of a building more than 3 stories tall. Your picture must contain at least one floor of the building.

name: Same street
description: Tell the seekers if you are on the same street as them

name: How do we get to you?
description:
Use Google Maps to navigate between the seeker’s location and your own.
List the mode of transport for each of the steps, in order.
E.g. Walk, Metro, Metro, Walk
